intro: Gymnogramma pinnata, commonly known as the feather fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that resemble feathers, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Gymnogramma pinnata has a rhizomatous growth habit and produces sporangia on the underside of its fronds. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is valued for its ornamental appearance in horticulture.
